messages.content: You are Nayra. Respond with JSON tarot reading.

Card: The Devil
Position: Answer
Seeker's question: "I am in my early sixties, and despite working hard my entire life, I find myself in a chain of bad events and a total financial collapse. Will this situation ever pass?"
Language: English

{"summaryTitle":"Summary","mainCard":{"cardName":"The Devil","symbolName":"The Devil","cardNameLocal":"The Devil","title":"The Mirror of Your Prison","subtitle":"A Tarot Revelation by Nayra","section":"ANSWER","sectionName":"The Shadow Truth","interpretation":"When The Devil appears in response to your financial collapse, it does not arrive to comfort you with false promises. This card is a mirror held up to the prison you've built—and perhaps more importantly, the prison that's been built around you.

The Devil's True Message: You are chained, yes, but look closely at the imagery—the chains around the figures' necks are loose. They could slip them off at any time, yet they remain. This is The Devil's first teaching: you are more trapped by your perception of being trapped than by the actual circumstances. Your hard work has been real, your efforts genuine, but The Devil asks: What contracts did you sign—not just on paper, but in your soul? What systems have you bought into that promised security but delivered servitude? The financial collapse you're experiencing is not just about money—it's about the entire structure of belief around money that you've been operating within.

The Shadow Truth reveals itself: The Devil represents our shadow relationship with the material world. In your case, it unveils toxic patterns disguised as 'hard work' or 'responsibility,' invisible chains of societal expectations about success and worth, the addiction to struggle itself—believing that suffering validates your efforts, and external forces that have benefited from your labor while keeping you dependent. This card says your liberation begins with accepting the ugliest truth: The system was never designed for you to succeed through hard work alone. Your chain of bad events may not be random—they may be the natural outcome of participating in structures that extract more than they give.

The Devil doesn't offer easy comfort. Instead, it offers power through radical honesty about what isn't working—not just in your finances, but in your entire approach to material security. Break the addiction to conventional paths that have failed you. Embrace your shadow power—the parts of you that have been deemed 'too aggressive,' 'too demanding,' or 'too ambitious' by society. Recognize the game—see financial systems as constructs you can learn to navigate rather than moral judgments on your worth. Your financial situation has collapsed because the old structure needed to die. The Devil appears when we must face that our good behavior, hard work, and playing by the rules have led us not to reward, but to bondage. This is not your failure—this is your awakening.","keyInsightsLabel":"Key Insights","keyInsights":["The chains are loose—you are more trapped by perception than reality","Stop believing your worth must be earned through suffering","The collapse is your invitation to write your own rules of power and prosperity"],"summary":"The Devil reveals that your financial collapse is not random but the natural outcome of participating in extractive systems. Your liberation begins with slipping off the loose chains and creating your own definition of prosperity.","isPositive":false,"dailyInspiration":"Stop asking for permission to thrive—the chains were always loose."},"secondCard":{"section":"","sectionName":"","subSectionName":"","cardName":"","symbolName":"","cardNameLocal":"","relationshipToFirst":"","interpretation":"","keyInsightsLabel":"","keyInsights":[],"summary":""},"thirdCard":{"section":"","sectionName":"","subSectionName":"","cardName":"","symbolName":"","cardNameLocal":"","timingInteraction":"","interpretation":"","keyInsightsLabel":"","keyInsights":[],"summary":""},"finalGuidance":{"section":"INTEGRATION","sectionName":"From Bondage to Liberation","subSectionName":"Writing Your Own Rules","guidance":"The Devil's final teaching: Stop asking for permission to thrive. Stop believing that your worth must be earned through suffering. The chains are loose—slip them off and create your own definition of power and prosperity. The collapse is not your ending—it's your invitation to stop being a willing prisoner to systems that were never going to save you.","practice":"Each day, identify one 'rule' about money or success you've been following that no longer serves you. Consciously break it. Start small—challenge the belief that struggle validates worth.","summary":"Your transformation begins with embracing the uncomfortable truth that playing 'good' has gotten you here. Now it's time to get a little devilish—in the best way possible."}}}]}]
